Problem:
Consider a linear system governed by the equation \\(\\dot{x} = Lx\\), where L is a linear operator. We explore the effect of a Fourier transform \\(\\mathcal{F}\\), applied to the initial condition \\(x_0\\), on the evolution of the system over time.

Knowing the endpoint \\(x(T)\\), is it possible to precisely determine what transformations were applied (whether \\(\\mathcal{F}(x_0)\\), \\(Mx(t)\\) at t = t1, or both) based solely on the final state?
Explanation: The outcome at \\(x(T)\\) might result from various combinations of the initial Fourier transform and the mid-time intervention by M. Due to the linear nature of the system, it is not possible to uniquely reconstruct the pathway (transformations) from the endpoint state alone.
